summary: This is an FBI Collected Item Log documenting the submission of video evidence from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. The evidence consists of a hard drive containing surveillance video from the Special Housing Unit (floor 9) and Attorney Visit area (floor 3) for the period of July 23 to August 10, 2019, related to the death investigation of Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Deceased Inmate / Subject of Death Investigation
persons.context: The document is part of the investigation into his death while in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. He is listed as the victim in a death investigation.

events.title: Date of Death / Video Collection
events.description: Video from this date was collected as part of the death investigation. The log notes video was available for download for 8/10/2019.

events.title: Video Surveillance Period
events.description: Relevant video from the Special Housing Unit (floor 9) and Attorney Visit area (floor 3) was collected for this period, covering the time leading up to Epstein's death.

events.title: Failed Video Download
events.description: An attempt to download all available video for this date failed, as noted in the log.

events.title: Evidence Collection
events.description: The digital evidence (hard drive) was collected on this date at 11:30 PM EDT.

events.title: Evidence Submission Logged
events.description: The FBI logged the submission of the video evidence from the MCC on this date.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The FBI collected video surveillance evidence from the Metropolitan Correctional Center related to Jeffrey Epstein's death investigation.
The video covered the Special Housing Unit (floor 9) and Attorney Visit area (floor 3) from July 23 to August 10, 2019.
A specific attempt to download video from August 9, 2019, failed.
The evidence was a 500GB Seagate hard drive with serial number W2AEXSJV, downloaded from DVR1 at the MCC.
The document is an official FBI log, indicating the procedural handling of evidence in a high-profile death in custody case.
